intro: Mesembryanthemum herrei, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark star, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, round, edible fruits. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
